avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is moderate. Main problem: new snow. Due to solar radiation, small loose snow avalanches can trigger naturally in steep rocky terrain in all aspects. On steep slopes with smooth ground, in addition, glide-snow avalanches are possible. On the Main Allgau Ridge these releases can grow to medium size in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On extremely steep sunny slopes, small moist loose-snow avalanches expected

snowpackStructure.comment: Widespread 20cm of new snow, in the Allgäu at highest altitudes in the Allgau up to half a meter of new snow, deposited atop a stable old snowpack or bare ground. In near surface layers the fresh fallen snow is often deposited atop a breakable melt-freeze crust. The snowpack basis is wet over far-reaching areas.

tendency.highlights: Transition to springtime conditions, including daytime rise in avalanche danger

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. In isolated cases, new snow can be a problem. Small loose-snow slides can trigger naturally in extremely steep terrain wherever sufficient snow has fallen due to solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Small moist and wet loose-snow avalanches are possible in the sunshine

snowpackStructure.comment: Widespread 20cm of new snow, deposited atop a stable old snowpack or bare ground. In near surface layers the fresh fallen snow is often deposited atop a thin melt-freeze crust or a thoroughly wet old snowpack. The snowpack basis is wet over far-reaching areas.

tendency.highlights: Transition to springtime conditions, including daytime rise in avalanche danger

customData.generalHeadline: Fresh fallen snow triggering naturally in the sunshine
